publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-1949 Murdo Fraser: Re-election of President George W Bush—That the Parliament congratulates President George W Bush on his re-election for a further four years; notes that the Republicans’ effective and successful campaign saw President Bush decisively win the popular vote throughout the country as well as the Republicans maintaining control of, and increasing their representation in, both the Senate and the House of Representatives, ensuring stable government, and congratulates both Republicans and Democrats for running a high-profile campaign that has resulted in such a high turn-out of voters thus giving added credibility to the result.

S2M-1949 Re-election of President George W Bush (lodged on 3 November 2004) Alex Johnstone*, Mr Ted Brocklebank*, Mr David Davidson*, Mr Jamie McGrigor*, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*, Mrs Nanette Milne*, Phil Gallie*

S2M-1949 Murdo Fraser: Re-election of President George W Bush—That the Parliament congratulates President George W Bush on his re-election for a further four years; notes that the Republicans’ effective and successful campaign saw President Bush decisively win the popular vote throughout the country as well as the Republicans maintaining control of, and increasing their representation in, both the Senate and the House of Representatives, ensuring stable government, and congratulates both Republicans and Democrats for running a high-profile campaign that has resulted in such a high turn-out of voters thus giving added credibility to the result. Supported by: Alex Johnstone, Mr Ted Brocklebank, Mr David Davidson, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Mrs Nanette Milne, Phil Gallie, John Scott*, Mr Brian Monteith*
S2M-1949 Re-election of President George W Bush (lodged on 3 November 2004) Margaret Mitchell*
